content.description: Start with hands matched on rectangular rock jutting out of the face about three feet off the ground, and top out directly above after a few easy moves.
content.protection: Nothing needed, although a crash pad wouldn't hurt, especially since the top can be a bit crumbly.
content.location: Just to the right of the Lily Wall, on the right side of the cove separating the sport climbing area from the bouldering area.

content.description: Ascend the small but deep right facing crack. Down climb to the right.
content.location: To the right of Lily wall right before the trail stops.

content.description: Start on two hand rail jug and work up right on crack.
content.location: This boulder is not on the main trail by the other boulders. At the moment there is no trail leading to it. To get to it, follow the cliff line 50 yards further right past Ledge Fund. The boulder starts directly right of the obvious crack.

content.description: Climb the arete while starting low
content.location: Directly right of Open Arete Project

content.description: Begin low on undercling feature and climb straight up the arete
content.location: The arete feature 5ish feet right of the obvious crack feature

content.description: This is an open project that someone should go claim.  Sit start and follow the technical line straight up the face.
content.location: Climb the face starting 4ish feet left of the obvious crack.

content.description: Start on the lowest ledge and work your way up with a combination of mantles and jugs. May be tougher depending on height.
content.location: About 8ish feet to the right of Open Arete Project No.2

content.description: Starting with hands matched on the ledge (about five feet off the ground, just to the left of the two vertical cracks), traverse to the right, past the small vertical crack and then the bigger one, until you finish with your hands matched in the widest opening of the horizontal crack to the left of the tree (hand finish is about four feet to the left of the tree, and four feet off the ground).
content.location: Just to the right of the Lily Wall, along the short trail hugging the rock face. The finish is about four feet left of a tree very close to the rock face.

content.description: Starting with hands matched in the widest opening of the horizontal crack to the left of the tree (start is about four feet to the left of the tree, and four feet off the ground), traverse to the left, past the big vertical crack and then the smaller one, until you top out on the ledge just to the left of the smaller crack, about five feet off the ground.
content.protection: Nothing required, although a pad at the base of the finishing ledge could be nice for getting down after you top out.
content.location: Just to the right of the Lily Wall, along the short trail hugging the rock face. The start is about four feet left of a tree very close to the rock face.

content.description: Start with hands matched low on the small ledge about two feet off the ground, and top out directly above after a few easy moves.
content.protection: Nothing needed, although a crash pad wouldn't hurt, especially since the top can be a bit crumbly.
content.location: Just to the right of the Lily Wall, around the corner of the right side of the cove separating the sport climbing area from the bouldering area.

content.description: There is potential for about a half dozen boulder problems to the right of the Lily Wall.
